Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw the basic outline of two students and a string connecting them, showing some understanding of a string telephone.
The student can attempt to illustrate some materials, such as cups at the ends of the string.
The student can include partial labels in the drawing, trying to indicate parts of the telephone.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to accurately show how sound travels from one cup to another through the string (e.g., no sound waves shown, or drawn in the wrong direction).
The student may not correctly illustrate how the string needs to be taut for the device to work (string may be drawn as droopy or not straight).
The student might forget or incorrectly apply labeling or symbols to clarify the function of the drawing (e.g., unclear labels or missing symbols).
